intro: Borinda tengchongensis, commonly known as the Tengchong borinda, is a rare flowering plant native to the Tengchong region of Yunnan Province, China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous areas with high humidity. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat destruction, it faces threats to its survival in the wild.
